results.title: Effect of irbesartan versus atenolol on left ventricular mass and voltage: results of the CardioVascular Irbesartan Project.
results.text_hl: Effect of @CHEMICAL_Irbesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077405 @@@irbesartan@@@ versus @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on left @<m>DISEASE_MASS_syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536030 @@@ventricular mass@@@ and voltage: results of the CardioVascular @CHEMICAL_Irbesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077405 @@@Irbesartan@@@ Project.

citations.NLM: Schneider MP, Klingbeil AU, Delles C, Ludwig M, Kolloch RE, Krekler M, Stumpe KO, Schmieder RE. Effect of irbesartan versus atenolol on left ventricular mass and voltage: results of the CardioVascular Irbesartan Project. Hypertension. 2004 Jul;44(1):61-6. PMID: 15184349

results.title: Long-term antihypertensive treatment fails to improve E/e' despite regression of left ventricular mass: an Anglo-Scandinavian cardiac outcomes trial substudy.
results.text_hl: Five hundred thirty-six @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ had complete data collection at both phases. Left @<m>DISEASE_MASS_syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536030 @@@ventricular mass@@@ index regressed from phase 1 to 2 with no significant difference between treatment groups (@CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@: 119.5-116.8; @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@: 122.9-117.5; P<0.001 for both).

citations.NLM: Barron AJ, Hughes AD, Sharp A, Baksi AJ, Surendran P, Jabbour RJ, Stanton A, Poulter N, Fitzgerald D, Sever P, O'Brien E, Thom S, Mayet J, ASCOT Investigators. Long-term antihypertensive treatment fails to improve E/e' despite regression of left ventricular mass: an Anglo-Scandinavian cardiac outcomes trial substudy. Hypertension. 2014 Feb;63(2):252-8. PMID: 24218432
citations.BibTeX: @article{24218432, title={Long-term antihypertensive treatment fails to improve E/e' despite regression of left ventricular mass: an Anglo-Scandinavian cardiac outcomes trial substudy.}, author={Barron AJ and Hughes AD and Sharp A and Baksi AJ and Surendran P and Jabbour RJ and Stanton A and Poulter N and Fitzgerald D and Sever P and O'Brien E and Thom S and Mayet J and ASCOT Investigators}, journal={Hypertension}, volume={63}, number={2}, pages={252-8}}

results.title: Effect of single-drug therapy on reduction of left ventricular mass in mild to moderate hypertension: comparison of six antihypertensive agents. The Department of Veterans Affairs Cooperative Study Group on Antihypertensive Agents.
results.text_hl: Significant reductions at 1 year in adjusted @<m>DISEASE_MASS_syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536030 @@@LV mass@@@ were seen for @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ in the highest tertile of pretreatment @<m>DISEASE_MASS_syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536030 @@@LV mass@@@ treated with @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ (mean, -42.9; 95% confidence limits, -65.5, -20.2 g), @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ (mean, -38.7; 95% confidence limits, -61.0, -16.4 g), and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (mean, -28.1; 95% confidence limits, -50.9, -5.3 g).

citations.NLM: Gottdiener JS, Reda DJ, Massie BM, Materson BJ, Williams DW, Anderson RJ. Effect of single-drug therapy on reduction of left ventricular mass in mild to moderate hypertension: comparison of six antihypertensive agents. The Department of Veterans Affairs Cooperative Study Group on Antihypertensive Agents. Circulation. 1997 Apr 15;95(8):2007-14. PMID: 9133508
citations.BibTeX: @article{9133508, title={Effect of single-drug therapy on reduction of left ventricular mass in mild to moderate hypertension: comparison of six antihypertensive agents. The Department of Veterans Affairs Cooperative Study Group on Antihypertensive Agents.}, author={Gottdiener JS and Reda DJ and Massie BM and Materson BJ and Williams DW and Anderson RJ}, journal={Circulation}, volume={95}, number={8}, pages={2007-14}}

results.title: Relation of QT interval and QT dispersion to regression of echocardiographic and electrocardiographic left ventricular hypertrophy in hypertensive patients: the Losartan Intervention For Endpoint Reduction (LIFE) study.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: By using tertiles of @<m>DISEASE_MASS_syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536030 @@@LV mass@@@ change and adjusting for the difference in treatment (@CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@), shortening of the rate-adjusted QT intervals as well as reduction in QT(apex) dispersion were observed in the tertile showing the greatest decrease in @<m>DISEASE_MASS_syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536030 @@@LV mass@@@ but not in the tertile without substantial changes in @<m>DISEASE_MASS_syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536030 @@@LV mass@@@ despite a significant reduction in blood pressure.

citations.NLM: Oikarinen L, Nieminen MS, Toivonen L, Viitasalo M, Wachtell K, Papademetriou V, Jern S, Dahlöf B, Devereux RB, Okin PM, LIFE Study Investigators. Relation of QT interval and QT dispersion to regression of echocardiographic and electrocardiographic left ventricular hypertrophy in hypertensive patients: the Losartan Intervention For Endpoint Reduction (LIFE) study. Am Heart J. 2003 May;145(5):919-25. PMID: 12766755
